    API reference¶

    This page provides an auto-generated summary of gvpy’s API. For more details and examples, refer to the relevant chapters in the main part of the documentation.

    I/O¶

    io.loadmat(filename[, onevar])

    Load Matlab .mat files and return as dictionary with .dot-access.

    io.mat2dataset(m1)

    Convert dictionary with data into xarray.Dataset

    io.mtlb2datetime(matlab_datenum[, …])

    Convert Matlab datenum format to python datetime.

    io.read_sbe_cnv(file[, lat, lon])

    Read Seabird SBE37 .cnv file and return as xarray.Dataset.

    io.read_sadcp(ncfile)

    Read shipboard ADCP data file as produced by UHDAS.

    io.ANTS(filename)

    Reader for ANTS data files.

    io.ANTS.to_xarray()

    Convert ANTS object to xarray.Dataset.

    Ocean¶

    Dataset Access¶

    ocean.woa_get_ts(llon, llat[, plot])

    ocean.woce_climatology([lon, lat, z, std])

    Read WOCE climatology as xarray Dataset.

    ocean.woce_argo_profile(lon, lat[, interp, load])

    Extract profile at a single location from the WOCE ARGO Global Hydrographic Climatology (WAGHC).

    ocean.smith_sandwell([lon, lat, subsample, …])

    Load Smith & Sandwell bathymetry

    ocean.smith_sandwell_section(lon, lat[, …])

    Extract Smith & Sandwell bathymetry along sections defined by lon/lat coordinates.

    ocean.tpxo_extract(year, yday, lon, lat)

    Extract tidal velocity and height predictions from TPXO model.

    ocean.wind_stress(u10, v10)

    Calculate wind stress from 10m winds.

    Calculations¶

    ocean.nsqfcn(s, t, p, p0, dp, lon, lat)

    Calculate square of buoyancy frequency [rad/s]^2 for profile of temperature, salinity and pressure.

    ocean.tzfcn(CT, z, z0, dz)

    Calculate vertical temperature gradient for profile of conservative temperature and depth.

    ocean.bathy_section(bathy, lon, lat[, res, ext])

    Extract bathymetry along pathway defined by lon/lat coordinates.

    ocean.inertial_period(lat)

    ocean.inertial_frequency(lat)

    ocean.uv2speeddir(u, v)

    Convert velocity from u,v to speed and direction

    Signal Processing¶

    signal.lowpassfilter(x, lowcut, fs[, order])

    Lowpass-filter a signal using a butterworth filter.

    signal.bandpassfilter(x, lowcut, highcut, fs)

    Bandpass-filter a signal using a butterworth filter.

    Plotting¶

    Figures and Axes¶

    plot.axstyle([ax, fontsize, nospine, grid, …])

    Apply own style to axis.

    plot.nostalgic()

    Reading old papers and feeling nostalgic? Fear not! This will change the default matplotlib settings to transport you right back several decades.

    plot.back2future()

    Activate matplotlib settings from the default matplotlibrc file.

    plot.quickfig([fs, yi, w, h, fgs])

    Quick single pane figure.

    plot.newfigyy([width, height, fontsize])

    Create figure with own style.

    plot.add_cax(fig[, width, pad])

    Add a colorbar axis to a row of axes (after last axis.) This axis can then be passed on to a colorbar call.

    plot.ydecrease([ax])

    Set decreasing yaxis as often desired when plotting a quantity against pressure or depth.

    plot.ysym([ax])

    Set ylim symmetric around zero based on current axis limits

    plot.xsym([ax])

    Set xlim symmetric around zero based on current axis limits

    plot.xytickdist([ax, x, y])

    Set distance between ticks for xaxis and yaxis

    plot.concise_date([ax, minticks, maxticks, …])

    Better date ticks using matplotlib’s ConciseDateFormatter.

    plot.cartopy_axes(ax[, maxticks])

    Requires cartopy.

    Colors¶

    plot.colcyc10([ax])

    Set automatic color cycling for ax or current axis.

    misc.cmap_div([numcolors, name, mincol, …])

    Create a custom diverging colormap with three colors

    Plotting Methods¶

    plot.multi_line(x, y, z, ax, **kwargs)

    Plot multiple lines with color mapping.

    plot.pcm(*args, **kwargs)

    Wrapper for matplotlib’s pcolormesh, blanking out nan’s and thereby getting the auto-range right on arrays that include nan’s.

    Saving¶

    plot.png(fname[, figdir, dpi])

    Save figure as png.

    plot.figsave(fname[, dirname])

    adapted from https://github.com/jklymak/pythonlib/jmkfigure.py provide filename (fname)

    Little Helpers¶

    ocean.lonlatstr(lon, lat)

    Generate longitude/latitude strings from position in decimal format.

    io.str_to_datetime64(timestr)

    Convert date/time in str format to numpy’s datetime64 format.

    io.yday1_to_datetime64(baseyear, yday)

    Convert year day (starting at yday 1) to numpy’s datetime64 format.

    io.yday0_to_datetime64(baseyear, yday)

    Convert year day (starting at yday 0) to numpy’s datetime64 format.

    misc.near(A, target)

    Find index of value in A closest to target.

    misc.nearidx(array, value)

    Find index of value in array closest to target.

    misc.nearidx2(array, value)

    misc.getshape(d)

    Get dict with info on dict d

    misc.qpload(filename)

    Quick pickle - load

    misc.qpsave(filename, vars)

    Quick pickle - save

    plot.switch_backend()

    Debugging¶

    misc.extract()

    Copies the variables of the caller up to iPython.
